articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Revolutionary Museum of Ministry of People's Armed Forces
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Revolutionary Museum of Ministry of People's Armed Forces
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, visited the hall "Supreme Commander and Comrades-in-Arms" at the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of the death of Jo Myong Rok. Jo was a revolutionary comrade-in-arms of leader Kim Jong Il and prominent official of the party, state and army.
					 Kim Jong Un, who is also supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), had a look at Jo's photos and mementoes displayed in the hall.
					
					 He said that November 6 was the third anniversary of Jo's death.
					
					 Jo was a close comrade-in-arms of Kim Jong Il, he said, adding he missed Jo so much and visited the hall on the occasion of his death anniversary.
					
					 The feats Jo performed for the party, revolution, country and people will shine long along with the advance of the revolutionary cause of Juche, he noted.
					
					 He then went round the hall.
					
					 He said that the hall displays photos of President Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's lifetime comrades-in-arms who protected the party with arms by staking their destiny on the party and leader.
					
					 It was thanks to the harmonious whole and revolutionary comradeship between the supreme commander and his comrades-in-arms that the Korean revolution made triumphant advance despite all sorts of trials and difficulties, he noted. Commanding officers of the KPA, remaining infinitely loyal to the party and revolution, shared the same idea, intention and destiny with the supreme commander.
					
					 They were staunch revolutionaries and true soldiers who dedicated themselves to laying solid foundations for comradeship, pride of the Korean revolution and source of invincible might, and to developing the KPA into invincible revolutionary armed forces, he said.
					
					 He gave an important instruction to renew the hall.
					
					 He underscored the need to rebuild the hall to showcase the faith, obligation and feats of the revolutionary soldiers, who dedicated themselves to the party, leader, country and people, to help service personnel and people get a good knowledge of their noble ideological and mental world.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Su Gil, Ryom Chol Song, Ri Jae Il and Hwang Pyong So.

articles.title: Greetings to Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian President
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on October 31 sent a message of greeting to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of the start of the Algerian revolution.
					 Kim in his message affirmed the invariable support of the DPRK for the president and government of Algeria in their efforts to consolidate the political stability of the country and achieve the economic development, and sincerely wished the president good health and happiness and the friendly Algerian people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Turkmenistan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Turkmenistan
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on October 27 sent a message of greeting to Gurbanguly Berdymuhamedov, president of Turkmenistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Kim in the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Turkmenistan would continue to favorably develop, wishing the president and people of Turkmenistan greater success in their efforts for the socio-political stability of the country and economic development.

articles.title: Greetings to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian King
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to King Norodom Sihamoni on Friday on the occasion of the  60th anniversary of the independence of the Kingdom of Cambodia.
					 Kim said the Koreans are pleased to see the Cambodian people achieving the national reconciliation, unity, peace and stability after independence and great successes in building an independent and prosperous state and heartily hope the Cambodian people would make good headway in their work.
					
					 Convinced that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cambodia would further develop, he sincerely wished the King greater achievement in his noble work for the country and people.

articles.title: Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greeting to Hun Sen, prime minister of Cambodia, on Friday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the independence of the Kingdom of Cambodia.
					 The message wished the prime minister good health, happiness and greater success in his work, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between two countries would continue to develop on good terms.
					
					 On the same day Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to Deputy Prime Minister Hor Nam Hong, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Raps S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Raps S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- These days the south Korean puppet group is becoming more desperate in its moves to abduct inhabitants of the DPRK and hatch plots against it by use of defectors from the north. 
					 In this regard, the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued a statement on Friday.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 Agents of the puppet Intelligence Service (IS) of south Korea are now working with bloodshot eyes to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK by infiltrating members of such plot-breeding organizations as "Turi Hana" into its northern border area. They are, at the same time, bribing those who had been taken to south Korea before sending them back to the DPRK with the mission to gather information about it and destabilize it. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet Foreign Ministry set up what it called a "cooperation team" tasked to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK overseas and established similar teams in south Korean embassies in neighboring countries and Southeast Asian countries. The number of members of such teams is now on the sharp increase. 
					
					 The puppet Ministry of Unification shaped a budget to "finance river-crossing" and is going busy with operations to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK, providing funds through the "Foundation for Defectors from North".
					
					 It is wooing defectors from the north to stage performances on payment condition, thus using them for false propaganda against the DPRK.
					
					 The chief executive, prime minister and other heavyweights of the south Korean regime are zealously putting forward human scum, praising them as "fighters for independence." The south Korean regime is operating even a "course for training leaders for defectors from north" overseas after creating an organization called "academy of leaders of young defectors from north for unification." 
					
					 The operations to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK being carried out with various ministries and agencies and bosses in power involved and the conspiratorial racket kicked up by use of defectors from the north are something unprecedented. This clearly indicates what reckless phase they have reached. 
					
					 The above-said operations and conspiratorial ruckus are nothing but hysteric frenzy to tarnish the international prestige of the DPRK and break the single-minded unity and achieve their sinister purpose, taken aback by the stirring reality of the DPRK in which its people are making steady leap forward and winning victory after victory. 
					
					 The world knows no such brutal villains and depraved guys, obsessed with confrontation with fellow countrymen, as the south Korean puppet group which lures and abducts compatriots in broad daylight in wanton violation of sovereignty of other countries and international law, with all "government" institutions and human scum involved. 
					
					 The puppet regime's terrorism and conspiratorial plots are, in fact, hideous provocation against the people and social system of the DPRK and declaration of a war against it. 
					
					 The CPRK upon the authorization solemnly declares the following decisive practical actions to cope with the evermore undisguised abduction operations and conspiratorial plots of the puppet regime: 
					
					1. Those involved in the abduction of inhabitants of the DPRK and flesh traffic, participants in the smear campaign against the DPRK and violators of its sovereignty and human rights of its inhabitants will be on the list of merciless punishment, regardless of whether they are agents or servants of the IS. Namely Nam Jae Jun, director of the IS, the center of plot-breeding operations, will be its primary target. 
					
					2. The decisive actions to physically liquidate the despicable criminals and human scum will immediately kick off the moment they were declared. These decisive measures for national security and the guarantee of human rights of inhabitants are an exercise of due rights under the law of the DPRK and they are just and aboveboard in the light of international law. 
					
					 Whoever challenges the inviolable dignity and social system of the DPRK and abuses the human rights of its inhabitants will find no room to stay on this land. -0-
					
					The south Korean puppet group should know that they would get nothing with such foolish acts as sweeping the sea with a broom but self-destruction and denunciation at home and abroad. 
					
					The south Korean authorities and those on the list of punishment should keep in mind our ultimatum is not the warning of words anymore.

articles.title: DPRK RC Delegation Leaves for Australia
articles.content:
DPRK RC Delegation Leaves for Australia 
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Executive Vice-Chairman  Paek Yong Ho left here on Friday to take part in the 19th General Assembly and the meeting of the Board of Directors of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies to be held in Sidney, Australia.

articles.title: Chinese Government's Special Representative Leaves
articles.content:
Chinese Government's Special Representative Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special representative of the Chinese government for the issue of the Korean Peninsula, and his party went back home by air on Friday.

articles.title: South African Delegation Flies back
articles.content:
South African Delegation Flies Back
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the South African government headed by Ebrahim Ebrahim Ismail, vice-minister of International Relations and Cooperation, flew back home Friday.

articles.title: Japan Sports Delegation Visits Various Places
articles.content:
Japan Sports University Delegation Visits Various Places
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Nippon Sport Science University headed by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami toured the Munsu Water Park here Friday.
					 Being briefed on the fact that an excellent water park was built thanks to the noble intention and energetic guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the delegation looked round various facilities at the park.
					
					 They also toured the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Pyongyang International Football School, Mirim Riding Club, Pyongyang Folklore Park and various other places here, and historic relics in Kaesong City including the Koryo Museum.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by the art group members of the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.

articles.title: Students of DPRK, Japan Play Football Matches
articles.content:
Students of DPRK, Japan Play Football Matches
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Men and women's football matches between the sports university teams of the DPRK and Japan took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Thursday and Friday.
					 Among the spectators were Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ma Chol Su, secretary general of the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association, Sin Tong Gyu, rector of Korea University of Physical Education, officials concerned, football experts and fans and Pyongyangites including youth and schoolchildren.
					
					 The delegation of Nippon Sport Science University headed by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami also watched the matches.
					
					 The football players made the most of their team tactics.
					
					 The spectators enthusiastically applauded the players when they had scoring chances through excellent teamwork that led to good opportunities for shoots. 
					
					 The team of Korea University of Physical Education won in the men's football match and the women's match ended in a goalless draw.

articles.title: C.C., WPK Greets 15th International Meeting of Communist Parties and Workers' Parties
articles.content:
C.C., WPK Greets 15th Int'l Meeting of Communist, Workers' Parties
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) sent a congratulatory message to the 15th international meeting of the communist parties and workers' parties on Friday.
					 The Central Committee of the WPK said in the message that it is of the view that the current international meeting is of very great importance as the meeting opened in the historic period when it is a more urgent issue than ever before to boost the unity and cohesion of all anti-imperialist forces in the world to cope with the evermore undisguised aggressive and arbitrary acts of the imperialists to get rid of the daily worsening structural contradictions of the capitalist system and weather its crisis.
					
					 It sincerely wished the meeting greater success in its work, convinced that the meeting would offer an important occasion in encouraging and promoting the cause of justice of the revolutionary and progressive peoples of different countries in the world aspiring after independence and socialism against imperialism and in boosting unity, cooperation and solidarity among them.

articles.title: Reception Given by Polish Ambassador to DPPK
articles.content:
Reception Given by Polish Ambassador to DPPK 
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at the Polish embassy here on Friday to mark the independence day of Poland and the 65th anniversary of establishment of the DPRK-Poland diplomatic ties.
					 Present at the reception on invitation were Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung, officials concerned of the DPRK, diplomatic envoys and representatives of the international organizations here.
					
					 Edward Pietrzyk, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, and the staff of his embassy also attended.

articles.title: New Software Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Software Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK has recently developed new software.
					 The Control Machine Institute under the Academy developed open-type PLC software for CNC-16. This software has been already applied to some industrial establishments, including the Taean Heavy Machine Complex and the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex.
					
					 The Industrial Information Research Center of the Academy developed an integrated automation system for the Taedonggang Tile Factory. 
					
					 According to its researcher O Chung Song, with this system the factory has put all its management activities from order of products to their sale on an IT basis.
					
					 The Geological Institute, too, produced information programs for prospecting and exploitation to reduce vain tunneling and repeated operation.
					
					 The Turf Research Center of the Academy presented a program needed for creating and cultivating lawn.
					
					 All of the programs were appreciated at the 24th Software Contest and Exhibition held in Pyongyang from October 29 to November 4.

articles.title: October Issue of Magazine "Thongil" Released
articles.content:
October Issue of Magazine "Thongil" Released
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The International United Confederation of Koreans released the October issue of the monthly socio-political magazine "Thongil". 
					 It carried photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un going round the completed Mirim Riding Club and enjoying a performance given by the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia. 
					
					 It also carried a special write-up on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of the October 4 declaration illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il meeting with south Korean President Roh Moo Hyun in Pyongyang in October 2007. 
					
					 It dedicated an article titled "October and Workers' Party of Korea" to the 68th anniversary of the WPK. 
					
					 The article said the Down-with-Imperialism Union was formed on October 17, 1926 and the WPK was founded on October 10, 1945. 
					
					 The WPK elected Kim Jong Il as its general secretary on October 8, 1997, it added.
					
					 The magazine edited statements made public by the spokesmen for the DPRK National Defence Commission (NDC), the Policy Department of the NDC, DPRK, the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK, the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, etc., as regards the current issues related to the inter-Korean relations and the DPRK-U.S. relations. 
					
					 Seen in the magazine are historical data on the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Russia in 1948 to mark the 65th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties. 
					
					 It carried international news.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Kumgang (7)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Kumgang (7)
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- In Outer Kumgang of Mt. Kumgang there is a guard-shaped peak, called Rojok, which stands in front of Sujong Peak.
					 The peak tells about a legend well known among the local people.
					
					 Many, many years ago, Sujong Peak had rich deposits of crystal. So, foreign pirates frequently attempted to invade this area for crystal.
					
					 One day the villagers were told that dozens of pirate ships were sailing toward Jangjon Bay in the East Sea of Korea.
					
					 A young man of great strength devised a plan for driving back the invaders. With this plan, the villagers piled up rice straw, like a stack of grain, on a hill by the shore all night. And they turned the bay port milk-white by scattering white soil in waters as if a huge number of troops washed rice there for meal and made a campfire on Ppyojok Peak near the port to illuminate all those scenes.
					
					 The next day pirate spies came to see the grain stack, milk-white water and campfire, surmising that a large number of troops were stationed there. Overpowered by such terrific scenes, the foreign pirates could not but retreat from the area.
					
					 After all, the villagers repulsed the pirates' attack with wisdom and stratagem.
					
					 Since then people have called the hill "Rojok (stack of grain) Peak" and Ppyojok Peak "Chodae (candle) Peak".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands Immediate Dismantlement of Mechanism for Invading DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands Immediate Dismantlement of Mechanism for Invading DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Mechanism for a war of aggression such as the south Korea-U.S. "combined forces command" should be dismantled immediately and the U.S. occupation and domination over south Korea be terminated at an early date, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The command is a criminal military mechanism for the U.S. colonial domination over south Korea and for the provocation of a war against the north.
					
					 During the past several decades, the command worked out, supplemented and rounded off various war scenarios aimed to make a preemptive attack upon the DPRK and supervised military drills and arms buildup to help U.S. and south Korean forces get familiar with those scenarios.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are blatantly challenging the nation's aspiration and the demand of the era for the improved inter-Korean relations and the peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers are seeking to organize a new command instead of dismantling the "combined forces command" under the pretext of the "transfer of the right to control wartime operations."
					
					 The above-mentioned action is nothing but a ploy to nullify the "transfer of the right to command wartime operations" and deceive public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the U.S. is contemplating the conversion of this defunct mechanism into one for combined operations for invading the DPRK by letting member countries of the "UN Command" take part in the joint military drills including Key Resolve and Foal Eagle being staged in south Korea and its vicinity.
					
					 This is little short of a scenario to create a hotbed of a war on the peninsula and bring a root cause of threatening and disturbing peace and security in Northeast Asia and other parts of the world.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. justify the existence of the above-said mechanism or vindicate the presence of its forces in south Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Abiding by Fundamental Principle of International Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Abiding by Fundamental Principle of International Relations 
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- It has become a main trend of the present times to go in for independence. This is irresistible. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article:
					
					 The world today urgently requires the creation of a peaceful environment in the international relations and the promotion of development in the new century, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 However, the imperialists' war of aggression and military intervention have caused complicated issues in the international relations and laid a serious hurdle in the way of the people's cause of independence.
					
					  It is a particularly important issue to maintain independence in foreign relations if all countries of the world are to ensure the dignity and rights of the popular masses and achieve social progress and the development of civilization under this situation.
					
					 It is the unanimous desire and aspiration of mankind to lead an independent life free from all sorts of domination and subjugation by the imperialists.
					
					 The people's desire and wishes for independence are growing stronger as the days go by and social development is making rapid progress. This reality today calls for establishing the international relations between countries on the principle of respect for their sovereignty.
					
					 It is a basic principle to be adhered to in establishing sound international relations to maintain independence.
					
					 The Korean people will as ever make positive efforts to develop relations with all countries that respect the sovereignty of the DPRK and are friendly towards it, true to the idea of independence.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Puppet Forces' Moves to Join in U.S. MD
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Puppet Forces' Moves to Join in U.S. MD 
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities recently blustered that they would purchase several types of missiles including THAAD from the U.S. and set up a ballistic guided-missile operation control center by the first half of next year to interlock it with the TMD operation control center of the U.S.
					 It is reported that THAAD intercepts missiles of the opposing side at a falling phase.
					
					 Minju Joson Friday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that the puppet forces' advertisement of the "MD of south Korean type" is, in fact, nothing but a deceptive artifice to cover up their sinister plot to join in the U.S. MD.
					
					 The puppet group which reneged on its election commitments under the pretext of "financial shortage" is going to spend 4 trillion won for buying THAAD to hurt fellow countrymen.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the puppet regime is getting evermore undisguised in its moves to join in the U.S. MD after its adoption of the "tailored deterrence strategy" in collusion with the U.S., the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The puppet forces are the arch criminals disturbing peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in the region and escalating tension there as they are frantically stepping up the preparations for preemptive strike at the DPRK in league with the U.S. and getting busy with moves to prevent its retaliatory blows.
					
					 The U.S. and the puppet group will not be able to escape forlorn wandering spirits the moment they launch a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The puppet forces would be well advised to behave themselves, bearing deep in mind that their start of a war against the north in league with the U.S. is as foolish act as digging their own graves, warns the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Its moves to Forcibly Disband Opposition Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Its moves to Forcibly Disband Opposition Party
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- An editorial condemning the illegal act of the south Korean puppet regime to forcibly disband an opposition party was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People Wednesday.
					 The editorial recalled that the regime passed a motion calling for judgment on disbanding the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) at a "meeting of the State Council" and the chief executive approved it.
					
					 The Ministry of Justice lost no time to request the constitutional court to hold a trial for its disbandment and is working hard to deprive the lawmakers from the UPP of their "National Assembly" membership and ban their political activities, it noted.
					
					 The passage of the motion means the revival of "the emergency measure" dating back to the erstwhile "yusin" dictatorship and a groundless decision running diametrically counter to the law on disbanding political parties, it added.
					
					 The editorial accused the regime of employing a clumsy and base method to pass the motion by directly bringing up such crucial agenda item as the issue of disbanding a political party for discussion at the "meeting of the State Council" without discussing it at vice-ministers' meeting. 
					
					 The "Saenuri party," successor to the political party of such perpetrators of military coup and rebellion as Park Chung Hee and Chun Doo Hwan, is now being ridiculed and censured by the people as a party to be dissolved before any others for trampling down democracy, it said, adding:
					
					 Everybody can guess that lurking behind the above-said tyrannical action is the private intention of the present chief executive to seek revenge upon the representative of the UPP who criticized the erstwhile dictators including Park Chung Hee.

articles.title: Koreans in European Region Denounce S. Korean Authorities' Election Rigging
articles.content:
Koreans in European Region Denounce S. Korean Authorities' Election Rigging
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean community in the European region is conducting a dynamic campaign to protest against the south Korean puppet group's election rigging. 
					 Koreans held a candlelight rally in Paris on November 2 at which they condemned the south Korean puppet regime's illegal act, holding a placard reading "Park Geun Hye is not legal 'president'". The rally took place next day, too.
					
					 Rallies of Koreans were held in London on November 4.
					
					 Their participants declared that the interference in the election in south Korea by such power organs as the Intelligence Service (IS) was obviously an illegal act and political coup.
					
					 It is intolerable to gloss over the case, claiming that the election was over, they noted, declaring the election of Park was invalid.
					
					 Meanwhile, the European Solidarity of One Nation in a statement assailed the puppet group for being behind the IS case.
					
					 The statement said that there were illegal acts of the erstwhile dictators including the election rigging in south Korea on March 15, 1960 but the fraudulent election in 2012 was something unprecedented in the world.
					
					 Truth should be clearly probed, it held.

articles.title: Nepalese, Finnish Parties Flay S. Korean Regime for Seeking to Dissolve Progressive Party
articles.content:
Nepalese, Finnish Parties Flay S. Korean Regime for Seeking to Dissolve Progressive Party
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Nepalese and Finnish political parties issued statements on Oct. 30 and Nov. 2 respectively in denunciation of the south Korean authorities' moves to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist－Leninist) said that the south Korean conservative regime let the puppet Ministry of Justice set up a "special team for measures against unconstitutional political parties and organizations" and stage a farce of examining a bill on the disbandment of UPP. It called the move undemocratic and illegal.
					
					 It can never be an illegal action to struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, free activities of a political party and its democratic rights, the party held, demanding that such fascist suppression in south Korea be halted at once.
					
					 The Finnish Communists' League said:
					
					 We bitterly denounce the south Korean authorities for intensifying the suppression of UPP.
					
					 Park Geun Hye and her yes men are busy with a wholesale offensive to dissolve UPP.
					
					 The activities of the leftwing political parties are legally guaranteed even in the Western countries.
					
					 We strongly demand the authorities unconditionally set free the detained members of UPP and stop such fascist action at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Crackdown on Progressive Party Rapped in Indonesia
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Crackdown on Progressive Party Rapped in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Pioneer Party of Indonesia and the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange in a joint statement on Nov. 2 denounced the south Korean conservative regime for working hard to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 It said:
					
					 The present conservative ruling forces and the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea are staging a campaign to forcibly dissolve UPP on charges that it is "following the north and violating the constitution" though it has conducted legal activities since it came into being aspiring after justice and truth and reflecting the will and wishes of the working people.
					
					 This indicates that the conservative forces are desperately seeking to lay a foundation for their long-term office by eliminating the progressive forces and weakening the forces for democratic reforms and reunification.
					
					 We will wage a positive movement against the moves to forcibly disband UPP while paying due attention to the serious development in south Korea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam desea desarrollo de relaciones de amistad y cooperacion RPDC-Camboya
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam desea desarrollo de relaciones de amistad y cooperacion RPDC-Camboya 
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 8 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Camboya, Norodom Sihamoni, con motivo del 60o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais. 
					La misiva senala que el pueblo coreano se regocija de que despues de la independencia del pais el pueblo camboyano logro la conciliacion, la unificacion, la paz y la estabilidad de la nacion y alcanza gran avance en la construccion del Estado independiente y prospero, y desea de todo corazon que marchen bien todas las cosas en Camboya. 
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Camboya se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro, el remitente desea de todo corazon mayores exitos al destinatario en el noble trabajo para el pais y el pueblo.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje a su homologo camboyano
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje a su homologo camboyano
						
　Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, envio el dia 8 un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo camboyano, Hun Sen, con motivo del 60o aniversario de la independencia del Reino de Camboya.
					  El remitente expresa la esperanza y conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises seguiran desarrollandose favorablemente y desea al destinatario buena salud, felicidad y mayores exitos en su trabajo.
					
					   Por otra parte, el mismo dia, el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun hizo lo mismo al vicepremier y ministro de RR.EE. y Cooperacion Internacional de Camboya, Hor Nam Hong.
